intro: Convolvulus operculatus, commonly known as the hooded morning glory, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant produces trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and blue, often opening in the morning. Its leaves are alternate and heart-shaped, with a hairy texture. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release the seeds, which are small and black.
